newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Applied Materials up.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Applied Materials up.

text.p: A chorus of upgrades and positive anaylst comments turned around Applied Materials Inc shares, sending them to 35-1/8 from 30-7/8 preceding Friday's market open, traders said.
After the company held a conference call last night to detail fourth quarter results, several analysts turned more bullish on the stock, traders added.

Late Thursday, Applied reported fourth-quarter results of $0.40 per share after a $0.09 charge versus $0.84 one year ago. The First Call consensus forecast was $0.48 per share, excluding special charges.
Also, the company -- a maker of equipment that manufactures semiconductors -- said it expected an industry-wide downturn to continue into early 1997.
With the results and outlook, Applied shares fell in after-hours trade, surrendering a 1-1/2 rise to 32 won during the day.
Among those converted by the conference call were analysts at Merrill Lynch, PaineWebber, Morgan Stanley and Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, who all raised their opinion on Applied.
Elsewhere, Autodesk Inc attracted stock investors after announcing last night third quarter earnings that came in $0.01 above the First Call consensus estimate.
The shares gained two to 25-1/2 preceding the market open.
Autodesk said it earned $0.13 per share in the quarter versus $0.38 one year ago.
Traders also said they expect Eckerd Corp shares to trade up from 32-7/8 on news of antitrust clearance of J.C. Penney Co Inc's acqusition of the drug store chain.
